circulation.translation[0].definitions[0: the movement of blood around your body
Doctors had to remove her leg because of bad circulation.
circulation.translation[0].definitions[1: the exchange of information, money etc from one person to another in a group or society
The book was taken out of circulation.
The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
Police believe there are thousands of illegal guns in circulation.
circulation.translation[0].definitions[2: the average number of copies of a newspaper or magazine that are usually sold each day, week, month etc
The newspaper has a daily circulation of 55,000.
circulation.translation[0].definitions[3: the movement of liquid, air etc in a system
Let’s open the windows and get some circulation in here.
circulation.translation[1].definitions[0: the exchange of money within an economy
It was a bold anti-inflation plan, including a squeeze on the circulation of money.
circulation.translation[1].definitions[1: if money is in circulation, it is being used by people in an economy. If money is out of circulation, it is not being used
The old notes are being withdrawn from circulation.
An obvious sign of hyperinflation is the massive increase in the quantity of money in circulation.
circulation.translation[1].definitions[2: the average number of copies of a newspaper or magazine that are sold each day, week, or month
a mass circulation (=selling a very large number of copies) newspaper
